p.seg: Therefore if he lacks (virtue) in himself
but keeps (it) in his words,
even though he intensifies his orders,
the people will not follow him in these.
Therefore the frequent practice of the overawing application of punishments and fines,
derives from (the fact that) those in power do not commit themselves personally to it (=virtue).
Formerly the gentleman had a saying:
“war and punishments,
are (=show) the fallen virtue of the gentleman.”
Therefore if those above observe it personally,
then among the people there will necessarily be those who are (even) more intensely (observant) towards it.
When the gentleman wears plain dress and ceremonial cap (=ritual garments)
and stands on the steps,
the men in the whole palace (=the participant to the ritual at court) will not put limit to their respect (=they will show boundless respect).
When the gentleman wears mourning clothes and stands in the (ritually correct) position
the men in the whole palace will not put limit to their [grief (=they will show boundless grief).
When the gentleman wears a helmet and put on an armor and stands in front of the army],
If those above lead them,
then few of the people will not follow.
Nevertheless,
if his keeping (=reserve) (of virtue)
is not ample,
his weight
is not much.
Therefore the gentleman’s demands upon himself
(should) be deep.
If you do not obtain his root but attack (concentrate on) its tip,
you cannot obtain it.
Therefore the gentleman’s relationship with words,
is not to give value to the search for the lower flow (=details, consequences),
(but) to give value to exhausting (=examining) the source and reverting to the root.
If you do not follow its origin
and do not revert to its root,
there is nothing that can be obtained.
If the ruler enjoys what is already accomplished and does not think about the root,
[no achievement can be reached.]
If peasants while working for food are not diligent in plowing,
provisions will not be enough for them.
If scholars are accomplished in their words but do not act,
fame cannot be achieved.
Therefore the gentleman’s relationship with words
is not give value to the search for the lower flow (details, consequences),
but to give value to exhausting (=examining) the source and reverting to the root.
If you do not follow its origin
and do not revert to its root,
even by forcing them (the people) you cannot have them accept it (=your will).
If one is knowledgeable but abides to a (proper) order,
then the people will desire his knowledge to increase.
If one is rich but share with the poor,
then the people will desire his wealth to increase.
If one is eminent but able to yield,
then the people will desire his eminence to rise
If you go against this way,
the people will necessarily feel oppressed because of this,
and repay it (by overthrowing you),
is it possible not to be cautious?
Therefore if the gentleman (sits) on top of his bamboo mat,
yielding and giving (his place) to the young;
and if, as for his position in the court,
he yields (it) and occupies a low one,
(then) what he estimates will not be far (from Heaven’s will).
Common people do not fully display compassion towards others,
the gentleman does not fully display ritual propriety to others (in both cases, they should be yielding and not show off their good qualities).
Fording a dam or vying to get on a boat,
being first
is not as good as being last.
Competing about something by means of words,
winning
is not as good as ending.
The gentleman said:
“When one follows sincerity and dispels errors,
(then) what came first (the mistakes of the past?) can be eliminated,
and those who come (now) can feel trust.”
“I here estimate the heart of Heaven”,
When the “Jun shi” says:
“he looked at them and grandly and entirely displayed his virtue”
what does it mean?
It talks about urgency.
The gentleman says:
‘treat things with urgency,
if you do not act on them with urgency,
there is nobody who can make them deep.”
Making efforts towards them
and advancing,
is the work of strength;
to display them (the principles)
and be extensive (=extensively),
is the work of words.
Therefore being knowledgeable
Then, among the people, who would not follow him?
And if, taking shape in the middle (of the heart),
being manifested in his appearance,
his shaking (=his emotional impetus)
will be strong;
Then, among the people, who would not follow him?
Therefore the constant endeavor of those in power
(consists) in being trusted by the people.
The Shao Ming says:
“Being true to the multitude is to increase virtue”
what does this mean?
These words
mean
that when one is trusted by the people
one can increase virtue.
Only the way of the gentleman can be achieved nearby (straightening oneself),
and it can be established far away (giving order to society).
Formerly the gentleman had a saying:
“The sage is the virtue of Heaven”
what does it mean?
It says that you should obtain it (virtue) carefully in yourself,
and then you will be able to comply completely with Heaven’s rules.
The “Proclamation of Kang” says:
“For those who do not revert to the great rule,
King Wen instituted punishments,
to punish them without pardon”
what does it mean?
These words
say
that if someone did not oppose the rules of Heaven,
the punishments of King Wen were not heavy towards him.
Therefore the gentleman is careful towards the six positions,
to conduct sacrifices for the rules of Heaven.
